doc.field: Series XXIII: Pride and Progress / The Right Stuff
Series XXIII: Pride and Progress / The Right Stuff
[1]--Pride and Progress, Episode No. 35 [2]--The Right Stuff[Air Date: 8/31/1987]
[1]--Pride and Progress, Episode No. 35 [2]--The Right Stuff[Air Date: 8/31/1987]

Pride and ProgressNews-highlights:1. Gay Week in Review, with Andy Humm, David Strah, Jim Levin and guest Dr. Frank Lilly, only opendly gay member of the presidential commission on AIDS, sponsored by the Human Rights Campaign Fund 2.Dr. Frank Lilly goes into detail about the reasons for his selection and the commissions mandate among other things.COMMERCIAL: San Francisco AIDS Foundation3.Continuation of interview with Dr. Frank LilyCOMMERCIAL: Human Rights Campaign Fund4. Dr. Burton Lee meets with AIDS activists5.News Watch,Stirling Colgate has developed a software that projects levels of AIDS infection6.Meridian, Mississipi citizens protest the existence of a local gay bar called Poppers7. University of California doctor is testing a drug to help with impotency.8.Article on lesbianism in magazine called, "New Woman"9. Announcement regarding the October 11th March on Washington COMMERCIAL:First Hand10.GCN Sports interviews bowler Gutter George from [VBL]11. Lavender Health, Interview with Ellen Zaltzberg, an Education Coordinator of the Office of Gay and Lesbian Health Concerns of the NYC Department of Health, talks about homophobia12.Closing credits
The Right Stuff:1.Show Bitz, interview with Charles BushCOMMERCIAL:Manscape2.Naming Names, "Money Magazine" recieves criticism after publishing an article about a gay couple's financesCOMMERCIAL:The Islanders Club3.Just Ask Raz,Announcement about play, "Love Goddess" among other thingsCOMMERCIAL:The Monster4.Inside Out, Introducing Paco Rabanne5.Media Watch, Interview with Arthur Kirson, Cabaret Performer
[1]--Pride and Progress, Episode No. 35 [2]--The Right Stuff[Air Date: 8/31/1987]: August 1987
